snippet: Seabirds like Laysan albatrosses and wedge-tailed shearwaters flourish on Kaena Point as a new predator-proof fence keeps out cats and mongooses.
abstract: Predator-proof fence annexing Kanea Point nature reserve on a corner of Hawaii's Oahu island is helping to restore a once-thriving population of birds; Hawaii had more than 120 avian species before settlers arrived; all but a few species of landbirds have disappeared or diminished to tiny numbers, and may seabirds avoided extinction by flying to other islands.
lead_paragraph: Seabirds like Laysan albatrosses and wedge-tailed shearwaters flourish on Kaena Point as a new predator-proof fence keeps out cats and mongooses.

headline.seo: Birds of Kaena Point, Hawaii, Enjoy a Revival Thanks to a Fence
headline.main: Fence Is Behind an Explosion of Life in a Wild Corner of Hawaii
headline.print_headline: Fence Is Behind an Explosion of Life in a Wild Corner of Hawaii
